remarks: Extended real version of ~ leadd1 ; note that the converse implication is not true, unlike the real version (for example ` 0 < 1 ` but ` ( 1 +e +oo ) <_ ( 0 +e +oo ) ` ).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Aug-2015.)
statement: xleadd1a $p |- ( ( ( A e. RR* /\ B e. RR* /\ C e. RR* ) /\ A <_ B ) -> ( A +e C ) <_ ( B +e C ) ) $.
